stages.logText: I have made my way into the inner chamber in the Blackwater Mountain settlement and found a group of mages led by a man named Throdna.

Throdna tells me an interesting story. Apparently, Blackwater Mountain settlement and Prim used to trade and collaborate with each other just a few months ago. The priests of Prim and BWMS who are both skilled in various magic rituals were researching on the ancient sanctuary east of Prim and found out that it is a Kazaulean artifact. The Kazaul are described as mighty demons who used to rule over the world in its early days and were banished by the light of Elythara and then largely forgotten with the rise of the Shadow. Anyway, the priests got excited about the Kazaulean sanctuary and performed a magic ritual, activating a portal in the sanctuary and creating a major earthquake, damaging the houses of Prim and making the tunnel to Stoutford collapse. They did their research in secret of their secular leaders.Soon after, the Gornauds and wyrms started appearing out of nowhere. Throdna suspects it has something to do with the portal which remains active. Both factions started blaming each other for the massive damage caused and this is how the rivalry between the two villages started.

Several Blackwater mages have already gone through the portal and all but one have not returned yet. They were supposed to find out more about the Kazaul and how to put an end on their uprising. The messenger lost a five pieces of notes describing the Kazaul and their rituals which are now scattered across the mountain. I should go look for them on the way to Prim.
I have found the first third of the descriptions on Kazaul.
I have found the second third of the descriptions on Kazaul.
I have found the third third of the descriptions on Kazaul.
I found the  note describing the summoning of a Kazaul guardian.
I found the note describing the portal and the sanctuary.

Throdna thanked me for bringing him the five notes. The priests will now analyze them and look for further possibilities on how to close the the portal for good. I should investigate the Kazaul lair instead.
In the Kazaul lair, I met a guardian of Kazaul and many of his servants. He is guarding some sort of shrine similar to the one outside. I was unable to approach him and had to flee the lair.

Meanwhile Throdna has found a way to deactivate the portal. I should recite a Kazaulean chant in front of the guardian which should banish him. I was also given a vial of purifying spirit that Throdna wants me to apply to the shrine inside the lair. The shrine stores the immense powers of Kazaul. There is a chance that I won't be able to leave the lair after the ritual though.
By reciting the verses of the ritual chant, I was able to make the Kazaul guardian attack me.
I have purified the shrine of Kazaul. I was teleported out of the lair and the portal was disrupted and the sanctuary destroyed.

Throdna was very grateful that the threat from Kazaul is banished. Besides, the Wyrms and the Gornauds seem to be weaker now and in smaller numbers. I should also to talk to Harlenn of Blackwater Mountain and to Guthbered of Prim that they should stop fighting against each other.

I met a man seeking help for his settlement, the 'Blackwater Mountain settlement'. Supposedly, his settlement is being attacked by monsters and bandits from Prim, and they need help from the outside. Besides, the mine tunnel has collapsed due to a major earthquake recently.
I have agreed to help the man and Blackwater Mountain in dealing with the problem.
The man told me to meet him on the other side of the collapsed mine. He will crawl through the mine shaft and I will descend into the pitch-black abandoned mine.

I have navigated through the pitch-black  mine, and met the man on the other side. He seemed very anxious about telling me to head straight to the east once I exit the mine. I should meet the man at the bottom of the mountain to the east.
I heard a story about Prim and the Blackwater Mountain settlement fighting against each other.
I should follow the mountain path up the mountain to the Blackwater settlement.
I met the man again on my way up to Blackwater Mountain. I should proceed further up the mountain.
I have made it up to the snow-filled parts of the Blackwater Mountain. The man told me to proceed further up the mountain. Apparently, the Blackwater Mountain settlement is close by.
I have reached the Blackwater mountain settlement. I should find and talk to their battle master, Harlenn.

I have spoken to Harlenn in the Blackwater Mountain settlement. Apparently, the settlement is under attack by a number of monsters, the Aulaeth and white wyrms which he thinks were summoned by the mages of Prim.

I have made my way into the inner chamber in the Blackwater Mountain settlement and found a group of mages led by a man named Throdna who told me a very different story. Apparently the mages of Blackwater Mountain and Prim investigated a sanctuary of Kazaul east of Prim and opened a portal in their curiosity which caused an earthquake which damaged Prim and made the tunnel to Stoutford collapse. They did all of this in secret. Soon after, the Gornauds, wyrms and Auelaths started appearing. Both factions started blaming each other for the massive damage caused and this is how the rivalry between the two villages started. I should try to make Harlenn and Guthbered settle their conflict until the priests have deactivated the portal again.
I confronted Harlenn with the truth and he asked me to go to Guthbered and try to settle the conflict for the greater good.
Guthbered saw the truth as well and decides to stop his attacks on Blackwater Mountain settlement for now.

Harlenn wants me to give a message to Guthbered of Prim. Either the people of Prim stop their attacks on the Blackwater Mountain settlement, or they will have to be dealt with themselves. I should go talk to Guthbered in Prim.
Guthbered denies that the people of Prim have anything to do with the monster attacks on the Blackwater mountain settlement. I should go talk to Harlenn.
Harlenn is sure that the people of Prim are behind the attacks somehow.
Harlenn wants me to go to Prim and look for signs that they are preparing for an attack on the settlement. I should go look for clues around where Guthbered stays.
I have found some plans in Prim about attacking the Blackwater Mountain settlement. I should go talk to Harlenn immediately.
Harlenn thanked me for investigating the attack plans.
To make the attacks on the Blackwater Mountain settlement stop, Harlenn wants me to assassinate Guthbered in Prim. (He will send soldiers with me to overtake Prim.)
I have started a fight with Guthbered.
I told Guthbered that I was sent to kill him, but I let him live. He thanked me deeply, and left Prim.
I have told Harlenn that Guthbered is gone.
Harlenn thanked me for the help I have provided. Blackwater Mountain settlement will overtake Prim.
I am now trusted in the Blackwater Mountain settlement, and all services should be available for me to use.
I have decided to not help the people of the Blackwater Mountain settlement.
Since I am helping Prim, Harlenn no longer wants to talk to me.
Both factions settled their conflict peacefully. Now the portal has to be closed somehow.
Just outside the collapsed mine tunnel on the way to Blackwater Mountain, I met a man from the village of Prim. He begged me to help them.
The village of Prim needs help from someone from the outside to deal with attacks from some monsters. I should speak to Guthbered in Prim if I want to help them.
Guthbered can be found in the main hall of Prim. I should look for a stone house in the center of town.
I talked to Guthbered about the story about Prim. Prim has recently been under constant attack from the Blackwater Mountain settlement.
Guthbered wants me to go up to the settlement atop the Blackwater Mountain and ask their battle master Harlenn why (or if) they have summoned the Gornaud monsters against Prim.
I have talked to Harlenn about the attacks on Prim. He denies that the people of the Blackwater Mountain settlement have anything to do with them. I should go talk to Guthbered in Prim again.

I have made my way into the inner chamber in the Blackwater Mountain settlement and found a group of mages led by a man named Throdna who told me a very different story. Apparently the mages of Blackwater Mountain and Prim investigated a sanctuary of Kazaul east of Prim and opened a portal in their curiosity which caused an earthquake which damaged Prim and made the tunnel to Stoutford collapse. They did all of this in secret. Soon after, the Gornauds, wyrms and Auelaths started appearing. Both factions started blaming each other for the massive damage caused and this is how the rivalry between the two villages started. I should try to make Harlenn and Guthbered settle their conflict until the priests have deactivated the portal again.
I confronted Harlenn with the truth and he asked me to go to Guthbered and try to settle the conflict for the greater good.
Guthbered saw the truth as well and decides to stop his attacks on Blackwater Mountain settlement for now.
Guthbered still believes that the people in the Blackwater settlement have something to do with the attacks.

Guthbered wants me to go look for any clues that the people of the Blackwater Mountain settlement is preparing for a larger attack on Prim. I should go look for hints near Harlenn's private quarters, but make sure not to be seen.
I have found some papers around Harlenn's private quarters outlining a plan to attack Prim. I should go talk to Guthbered immediately.
Guthbered thanked me for helping him find evidence of the plans for an attack.
In order to make the attacks on Prim stop, Guthbered wants me to kill Harlenn up in the Blackwater Mountain settlement.
I have started a fight with Harlenn.
I told Harlenn that I was sent to kill him, but I let him live. He thanked me deeply, and left the settlement.
I have told Guthbered that Harlenn is gone.
Guthbered thanked me for the help I have provided to Prim. Prim will overtake Blackwater Mountain settlement.
I am now trusted in Prim, and all services should be available for me to use.
I have decided to not help the people of Prim.
Since I am helping the Blackwater Mountain settlement, Guthbered no longer wants to talk to me.
Both factions settled their conflict peacefully. Now the portal has to be closed somehow.
